history.proof: intros x. unfold filter_le. intros P HP. destruct x. - unfold Rbar_locally', Rbar_locally in *. hauto l: on depth: 3. - unfold Rbar_locally', Rbar_locally in *. auto. - unfold Rbar_locally', Rbar_locally in *. auto.

chat.content:
Help me to prove a theorem in Coq, based on provided proof states including hypotheses and goals. Give a complete proof in only one single code block without explanations, extra definitions. Give a complete proof in one response, only give the proof body, without repeating the definition and "Proof.". Avoid existing names when using intros. Write the commands separately, without ";" and "[cmd|cmd]". Use bullets for structure, NEVER use "{" and "}". When -, + and * are used out, proceed to double versions like --, ++, etc. For example, given proof state:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m
============================
m + S n = S n + m
The hypotheses n, m: nat and IHn: m + n = n + m are given first, then the goal, m + S n = S n + m, separated by =. Expect a response like: 
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` 
You do not intros any terms because all terms have already been introduced.

When I give:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m
============================
n, m: nat
your answer should be like:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```
Definitions and lemmas related to the proof will be provided, use them accordingly.


Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall x : Rbar, filter_le (Rbar_locally' x) (Rbar_locally x)

Premises:
Rbar_locally' = fun (a : Rbar) (P : R -> Prop) => match a with | Finite a0 => locally' a0 P | p_infty => exists M : R, forall x : R, M < x -> P x | m_infty => exists M : R, forall x : R, x < M -> P x end : Rbar -> (R -> Prop) -> Prop Argument scopes are [_ function_scope]
Inductive Rbar : Set := Finite : R -> Rbar | p_infty : Rbar | m_infty : Rbar For Finite: Argument scope is [R_scope]
Rbar_locally = fun (a : Rbar) (P : R -> Prop) => match a with | Finite a0 => locally a0 P | p_infty => exists M : R, forall x : R, M < x -> P x | m_infty => exists M : R, forall x : R, x < M -> P x end : Rbar -> (R -> Prop) -> Prop Argument scopes are [_ function_scope]
filter_le = fun (T : Type) (F G : (T -> Prop) -> Prop) => forall P : T -> Prop, G P -> F P : forall T : Type, ((T -> Prop) -> Prop) -> ((T -> Prop) -> Prop) -> Prop Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope function_scope]
Rbar_locally'_filter : forall x : Rbar, ProperFilter (Rbar_locally' x)
Rbar_locally_filter : forall x : Rbar, ProperFilter (Rbar_locally x)
locally_le_locally_norm : forall x : ?V, filter_le (locally x) (locally_norm x) where ?K : [ |- AbsRing] ?V : [ |- NormedModule ?K]
locally_norm_le_locally : forall x : ?V, filter_le (locally_norm x) (locally x) where ?K : [ |- AbsRing] ?V : [ |- NormedModule ?K]
Rbar_opp_involutive : forall x : Rbar, Rbar_opp (Rbar_opp x) = x
Rbar_opp_le : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_le (Rbar_opp x) (Rbar_opp y) < -> Rbar_le y x
Rbar_abs_lt_between : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_lt (Rbar_abs x) y < -> Rbar_lt (Rbar_opp y) x /\ Rbar_lt x y
Rbar_is_ub_subset : forall (E1 E2 : Rbar -> Prop) (l : Rbar), (forall x : Rbar, E1 x -> E2 x) -> Rbar_is_upper_bound E2 l -> Rbar_is_upper_bound E1 l
Rbar_lb_le_ub : forall (E : Rbar -> Prop) (l1 l2 : Rbar), (exists x : Rbar, E x) -> Rbar_is_lower_bound E l1 -> Rbar_is_upper_bound E l2 -> Rbar_le l1 l2
Rbar_is_lub_subset : forall (E1 E2 : Rbar -> Prop) (l1 l2 : Rbar), (forall x : Rbar, E1 x -> E2 x) -> Rbar_is_lub E1 l1 -> Rbar_is_lub E2 l2 -> Rbar_le l1 l2
locally_filter : forall x : ?T, ProperFilter (locally x) where ?T : [ |- UniformSpace]
Lub_Rbar_eqset : forall E1 E2 : R -> Prop, (forall x : R, E1 x <-> E2 x) -> Lub_Rbar E1 = Lub_Rbar E2
is_lub_Rbar_correct : forall (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), is_lub_Rbar E l < -> Rbar_is_lub (fun x : Rbar => is_finite x /\ E x) l
is_ub_Rbar_correct : forall (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), is_ub_Rbar E l < -> Rbar_is_upper_bound (fun x : Rbar => is_finite x /\ E x) l
is_lb_Rbar_correct : forall (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), is_lb_Rbar E l < -> Rbar_is_lower_bound (fun x : Rbar => is_finite x /\ E x) l
is_glb_Rbar_correct : forall (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), is_glb_Rbar E l < -> Rbar_is_glb (fun x : Rbar => is_finite x /\ E x) l
is_lb_Rbar_subset : forall (E1 E2 : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), (forall x : R, E2 x -> E1 x) -> is_lb_Rbar E1 l -> is_lb_Rbar E2 l
is_lub_Rbar_eqset : forall (E1 E2 : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), (forall x : R, E2 x <-> E1 x) -> is_lub_Rbar E1 l -> is_lub_Rbar E2 l
is_ub_Rbar_subset : forall (E1 E2 : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), (forall x : R, E2 x -> E1 x) -> is_ub_Rbar E1 l -> is_ub_Rbar E2 l
is_glb_Rbar_eqset : forall (E1 E2 : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), (forall x : R, E2 x <-> E1 x) -> is_glb_Rbar E1 l -> is_glb_Rbar E2 l
locally' = fun (T : UniformSpace) (x : T) => within (fun y : T => y <> x) (locally x) : forall T : UniformSpace, T -> (T -> Prop) -> Prop Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope]
Rbar_lt_locally : forall (a b : Rbar) (x : R), Rbar_lt a x -> Rbar_lt x b -> exists delta : posreal, forall y : R, Rabs (y - x) < delta -> Rbar_lt a y /\ Rbar_lt y b
filter_le_trans : forall (T : Type) (F G H : (T -> Prop) -> Prop), filter_le F G -> filter_le G H -> filter_le F H
norm_compat1 : forall (x y : ?V) (eps : R), norm (minus y x) < eps -> ball x eps y where ?K : [ |- AbsRing] ?V : [ |- NormedModule ?K]
is_glb_Rbar_subset : forall (E1 E2 : R -> Prop) (l1 l2 : Rbar), (forall x : R, E2 x -> E1 x) -> is_glb_Rbar E1 l1 -> is_glb_Rbar E2 l2 -> Rbar_le l1 l2
is_lub_Rbar_subset : forall (E1 E2 : R -> Prop) (l1 l2 : Rbar), (forall x : R, E2 x -> E1 x) -> is_lub_Rbar E1 l1 -> is_lub_Rbar E2 l2 -> Rbar_le l2 l1
Build_ProperFilter : forall (T : Type) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop), (forall P : T -> Prop, F P -> exists x : T, P x) -> Filter F -> ProperFilter F
norm_compat2 : forall (x y : ?V) (eps : posreal), ball x eps y -> norm (minus y x) < norm_factor * eps where ?K : [ |- AbsRing] ?V : [ |- NormedModule ?K]
Rbar_le_refl : forall x : Rbar, Rbar_le x x
filter_forall : forall P : ?T -> Prop, (forall x : ?T, P x) -> ?F P where ?T : [ |- Type] ?F : [ |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [ |- Filter ?F]

```coq
intros x.
unfold filter_le.
intros P HP.
destruct x.
- unfold Rbar_locally', Rbar_locally in *.
  apply locally_norm_le_locally.
- unfold Rbar_locally', Rbar_locally in *.
  assumption.
- unfold Rbar_locally', Rbar_locally in *.
  assumption.
Qed.
```
